reviewText: Spoiler alert: The German "Brokeback Mountain" it is not.In fact it is more likeThe Onewith basically the same story line complete with the same pathetic outcome. Firstly the stupidity of men spending so much time trying to be fit with a cigarette constantly hanging from their lips just looked so wrong and very un-sexy. I for one don't want to kiss someone who has been smoking, yuck! The story of two men loving one another only to be struck down by homophobia has been done before many times and this is just another example, and the ending just as predictable. This film could have been so much better without the cigarettes and the stupid ending, The two leading guys played by Hanno Kiffler and Max Riemelt save this film from being a one star disaster to three stars.
summary: The German "Brokeback Mountain" it is not.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: The acting is superb .THE TWO MAIN CHARACTERS HAD STRONG CHEMISTRY .VERY SEXY SCENES.COULDN'T FIGURE OUT HOW IT WAS GOING TO END,KEPT ME WANTING MORE AND MORE..IT'S ONE I WILL WATCH AGAIN.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: It's okay. Very well acted & shot, but it squanders a really interesting opportunity - to deeply tell the very real story of a straight guy and expectant father who, out of nowhere, falls for a gay guy. There's so little dialogue in the movie you learn very little about the central characters. They're both charismatic and hold your interest just looking at them, but there are too many scenes where nothing is said. With a story this weighty you want to know more what's going on in their heads. Also, it's almost like a straight person's view of gay people - the gay guy is predatory and introduces the straight guy into a world of drugs, disco and sex. That's it - nothing to make the straight guy want to leave his pregnant girlfriend other than forbidden hot stuff. Someone should make a version of this where the dramatic possibilities, and they are there in this simple story, explode.
summary: it's almost like a straight person's view of gay people - the ...
Title: Free Fall

Title: Free Fall

reviewText: I thought this movie was really great. To me the characters were very believable and natural. Max Riemelt and Hanno Koffler made their roles very real to me. They are very easy on the eyes too. This was not only a moving story but a glimpse into the regular work a day live in modern Germany such as family, pot smoking, gay discrimination and toleration in the work place, customs, and apartment life. This was not a happily ever after Hollywood ending but it did end on an up note. I felt the joy of first love and the pain of two failing relationships. I found my self wondering “how they made out after the movie ended”. But then it is just a movie and the actors went home.I believe this movie is worth the money and time to watch it.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Could not keep my eye off this one.  It is a heavy drama with lots of twist and turn.  Don't want to say much about  other than it should not be missed.  Saw this at a film festival and as soon as it is released on March 4, I shall be purchasing my copy.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: I have to say I'm not a fan of subtitled movies. And sometimes the subtitles in this movie were hard to read because in some cases you see white lettering against a pale or bright background. But I did take German in high school and was able to follow along and understand to some degree as to what was being said and what was happening via body language. I tend to agree with other reviewers that this movie is similar to Brokeback Mountain. And I do think that sometimes this happens today in real life where some men are supposedly bisexual or can't admit that they are really gay, but can't admit it because of the morals and values they were brought up with. Sometimes there are men who are really gay, but simply follow the herd and confirm to societal norms. I have to say that both characters in this movie were very good looking and their romantic interaction with each other was pretty good! I found Kay, the one who was the gay one, to be the most attractive with his short, buzzcut haircut and scruffy face.
summary: Good looking actors and good romantic interaction!
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: The story line was so sincere, the characters believable.  Their heart wrenching love, their responsibilities, their commitments, all very real and sincerely acted.  The love scenes were just enough to stir, and not enough to be porn.  It was very well done.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: This film hits all the right marks, good script, good acting, good production.  We are drawn into the struggle of a man, in a "manly" culture and surrounded by a seemingly loving family, who just happens to fall in love with another individual--who is a male. I can appreciate how the director/writer/actors do not allow the protagonist to shrink from the dilemma of his circumstance. At every turn, he is confronted and cannot avoid the reality of his struggle. Viewers feel his sense of desperation and claustrophobia as do the other characters and relationships the protagonist has in the film--no one goes unaffected by the struggle of the individual. The pressures of his work and colleagues, coupled with the pressures of his family are palpable--that's good writing and that's good acting.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Freier Fall, in which two ostensibly straight males fall into bouts of illicit lovemaking in inhospitable locations, plays like an adolescent homosex phantasy. It's accordingly derivative and predictable, like most films that put homosexual arousal center stage, then figure out a scenario that will make the inevitable lip-locking as implausible as possible for the biggest pay-off. With rare exceptions (Marco Berger's Plan B comes to mind) this inevitable meeting of mucus membranes eventuates with the suddenness of an act of desperate violence. To that end Stephen Lacant spends an inordinate amount of time establishing the masculine bone fides of the protagonists, to such an extent that it threatens to become the main focus of the film. Given the plasticity of the male sexual response in homosocial environments, the scenario of two police cadets getting the hots for one another is not incredible--but neither is it novel or particularly interesting. Lacant has merely produced his version of the standard doomed gay romance. Films dealing with homosexual persecution and paranoia have been made since the 1970s (Wolfgang Peterson's Die Konsequenz and Claude Miller's The Best Way to Walk come to mind)--with greater nuance and humanity. The experience of inconvenient homoerotic arousal in and of itself is an insufficient thematic for average filmmakers, I don't care how much splicing and edgy verité stylization its packaged in. Protagonists whose sole purpose is to channel anomalous sexual predilections wind up as ciphers of animal mediocrity.Freier Fall's similarity to Brokeback Mountain has been remarked upon. I would draw parallels with another recent film about illicit homosexual bonding, Nicolo Donato's disturbing Broderskab (Brotherhood 2009). Again, the comparison is to the detriment of the formulaic Freier Fall. Donato's film was vastly superior because the homosexual attraction wasn't front & center, but one factor in a complex of engaging, if rather horrifying, themes.Max Riemelt, who plays Kay is a telegenic and engaging presence on screen, if not quite in the league of Volker Bruch in terms of intensity. Hanno Koffler as the repressed (or just clueless?) Marc broods with the best of them, but has the physicality of a Guinea Pig on steroids. A walking muscle-mass with tunnel vision, hair-trigger fuse, and a lecherous-malign glint in his eyes, he resembles a figure out of a Lucas Cranach portrait. Yet for all his irascibility, borderline autism, and  inarticulacy, he's not particularly spirited.With cortisol surges and the fight-flight reflex dictating events, flying fists and sudden retreat are the inevitable outcome of every encounter that doesn't end in furtive homosex. I get that these two are struggling with illicit desires in a no-win situation, but their inability to converse with one another as persons radically limits their appeal. That well-spokenness kills the mood of rude and randy man-on-manism seems to be a generally accepted fact among primitivists and pornographers, but give me a break. These two academy trainees spend all their time either working out, fighting, or having sex. (You know, like real men...) Oh, and Marc has a pregnant girlfriend who turns into an real nag when his interest wanes, sealing the deal of his straight-arrow credentials.Romance risks comedy when it confronts lovers with the necessity of its normalization. Once domesticated passionate partnerships generally transform into delicate, maintenance intensive stand-offs. Kay and Marc, inhabiting the realm of non-negotiable erotic impulses, never get that far. Their relationship, while tested by divided loyalties, lacks the civilizing dimension of habit and the intimacy of two minds meeting in sympathy. It remains a conflict (fight) resolved by the (SPOILERS!) sudden absconding (flight) of one of the partners.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: A good production but incomplete narrative & unsatisfying ending. There's not enough within this story to justify the happenings. *Maybe Spoilers* Handsome married Marc is at police academy and befriends hot, rule-bending Kay. We see Marc open to Kay's rule bending influence, but overwhelmingly we see him engaged in a happy married life with a lovely pregnant wife and supportive family. Almost randomly Kay forces himself on Marc. After some exposition of Marc's inner struggle, a sexual affair ensues. We see it coming, cause it's on the cover art for the film; but there's not enough in the story to see it coming. Later, although Kay doesn't seem the type, he professes love for Marc. After Marc's mother catches them kissing, Kay confesses his feelings to Marc's parents, when they confront him at a party at Marc's house, sooooo that's not right. The story isn't Fatal Attraction like so what gives? Obviously Marc has feelings of attachment to Kay but never confesses love for him. He denies being gay after the affair is discovered and the film even shows Marc unable to engage in sex with another guy during an emotional bottoming out. (I hate gay sex used as rock-bottom for an emotionally distressed person; as in "Shame.") So therein lies the problem with the storytelling; What is the story telling? The unsatisfying end doesn't give closure. It gives an impression that Marc will be OK. But the good people around him and their stories are left shattered. That's not like Marc; he's no sociopath; so again, what gives? We might conclude he was suffocating in a really great life and the affair was his escape, but there was something specific for him about Kay, and nothing to indicate the emotional burden. Maybe it's a cautionary tale for "hot for married guy" gays; Look what your lust shall bestow! Nah, it's a story of self discovery; of the power, surprise and consequence of unexpected physical attraction, though it doesn't say so. Uptick to 3 stars for production, acting talent and many elements of the story that left me feeling a lot. Down-tick to 3 stars for a vague narrative that renders a plausible plot confounding and well played characters incomplete.
summary: Great Production of a Story that Lacks Motivation and Purpose
Title: Free Fall

Title: Free Fall

reviewText: I just received this film today and finished watching it already.  Free Fall ("Freier Fall" auf Deutsch) is a MUST HAVE, MUST BUY!  The acting is totally good, script / plot is very believable, and I was drawn into the story without hardly any thought as to the mechanics of movie making.  Both main stars, Max Riemelt and Hanno Koffler, are superb as two policemen who become star-crossed lovers.  Koffler's character, Marc  is living with his girlfriend and they are expecting a baby anytime soon, so the complications are immediate.  Katharina Schüttler plays Marc's girlfriend very well, with the joy of romance and imminent motherhood, and the tragedy of discovering your partner has been in an affair, all portrayed with great skill.  Supporting cast are also all quite good, and editing is seamless.  The English version has the German language with English subtitles, but the movie is so good, you'll probably forget you're reading the subtitles very quickly.  It's good to hear these actors' voices anyway.One side note:  The DVD has the two leading actor's names in the summary notes on the back cover confused with the other's role.  Also, Riemelt's name is misspelled as "Reimelt" in the leading paragraph of the Wolfe should correct this!  I'm going to check the Blu-Ray and German version to see if they are also incorrect, since I am interested in buying a Blu-Ray version.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: One of the best movies in my collection. Well acted, and has intense realistic themes any gay man can recognize and relate to. The initial hookup is heartbreakingly erotic. Calling the movie "The German Brokeback Mountain" is a gross understatement as it more than stands on it's own. I love this movie.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: I found it to be one of the best gay movies that I have ever seen. It reveals how love between two men can be so easily destroyed by society. Even in these modern times with legalized marriage for same sex partners. The movie underscores that many parts of this world that loving someone of the same sex can still be challenged by the hostility of our parents, peers and the rest of society. As a gay male I have been with my partner for over 40 years but am still reminded by the struggle we faced  trying to survive against all odds. I wish it had ended with both police officers  living happily ever after. But reality shows its ugly face once again. The acting was so convincing that I was very much affected by the two gay police officers emotional conflicts, especially the main character who is married and is expecting his first child. It's a movie I will maybe watch only a few times because the ending was very heart breaking. Like so many other viewers, I hope a sequel is  made with a happy ending, which will very much justify the first.
summary: A Very Sad Movie That's Very Well Done
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Many scenes were hot and exciting, so on that alone the movie was worth watching.  The movie tried to portray a coming out struggle as well, and the homophobia rampant through the community -- I was a bit surprised that gay issues were still so relevant in modern Germany.  I would have thought that gay relationships were a non-issue -- the movie seems about five years behind times.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Did we really need another movie about how stupid straight men are, about how brutal homophobia is, or about how cowardly married men who lust after other men are? Haven't we gotten past this crap - like about 20 years ago?Maybe they haven't in Germany. Maybe this movie (which is being touted as "the German Brokeback Mountain" by its US distributor) has a useful function for Germans, if they're really as thick-headed and slow as this movie makes them seem. But we gay men in the West, who've been fed the same old same old same old depressing homophobic crap year after year after year, have had enough already.Like Brokeback (which I also hated) this is a movie BY straight people (on both sides of the camera) and FOR straight people, who really may be so dumb that they need to see it all over again. WE! DON'T!I hated this ugly, depressing movie. Even Max Riemelt (Kay), one of the most beautiful men in the world, looks bad here - and what he would ever see in Hanno Koffler (Marc), one of the ugliest, is beyond imagining. There is no "chemistry" between them, by the way, only dark, slogging depression, dishonesty and cowardice - in Marc, who, unfortunately, is the star of this movie, and the only character who is given even the shallowest bit of depth.If you're German, or a homophobe, or a straight married man who'd rather be gay but doesn't have the GUTS it takes to be gay - then this movie may be for you. If you're a gay man who loves being gay, watchPit Stopinstead. It's fantastic, the best gay movie ever (unless you're an action addict).
summary: Haven't we gotten past this crap?
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: This finely acted drama that resolves itself unexpectedly is not exploitative  soft gay porn. Yes it is erotic and the two protagonists are hot cops, but the story of a young "straight" cop who is a new father and his affair with a  gay roommate at his police academy, plays out in unexpected ways. You expect him to just have the affair and reject the man, going back to his straight life. But the affair changes something basic in him and he discovers too late how deep his feelings are. He also comes to terms with the ostracism a gay life can bring with both his shocked parents and his narrow minded straight co workers. All in all this is an erotically charged piece but mostly it's a Finley acted one with two (I assume) straight actors who really go there.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: I thought this was a pretty cool film.  The characters are attractive and believable, and I thought the emotional struggles faced by the guy who was fighting his "gay inclinations" were depicted in an accurate and believable way.  In general, I've noticed that we seem to have more gay-themed filmed that are highlighting the fact that gay people often have difficulties not just with societal and family acceptance, but with overcoming their own internalized barriers to accepting themselves.  I mean really... we all want to fit in, and for LGBT folks, it's not the easiest thing.  Movies like this one portray that struggle in a realistic but entertaining way.  I would definitely recommend it.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: I have been relatively laxed on purchasing gay cinema. During the late 80s/early 90s, I purchased more gay media than I could have dreamed. For every "Before Night Falls" or "For a Lost Soldier", there were dreadfully bad gay movies being manufactured on the regular.I came across the trailer for "Free Fall" and it seemed to have all the key buzz words in its marketing campaign.There are typical stereotypes like the self-hating gay and your typical menacing homophobes.Where the film turns is in its exploration how life outside of German metropolis', homophobia seems to be alive and well. Small irritant moments include first time penetrative sex happens without lubricant. The most evolved character of the two, also happens to be portrayed as the home wrecker of a young hetero marriage. Villains like that don't belong in a 2014 gay film.
summary: Germany's Answer to Brokeback, This is NOT!!
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Free Fall is very, very well done. A policeman, father-to-be faces unearthed feelings with another policeman. This is a tale so familiar to so many gay men. These two young men's lives go through dramatic stress as they work to realize their lives in different ways. It is a compelling film and stayed with me long after I watched it. The conflicts are real and the movie excellent! Highly recommended!
summary: Few things hotter than a handsome polizei

reviewText: Beautiful story that's relatable and poignant! Good acting and superb chemistry throughout! Sometimes the best offerings in gay or gay-related cinema comes out of Germany!!

reviewText: The lead actors in this film are fantastic. The storyline is as it has been explained in other reviews. Sadly, life doesn't turn out OK for any of the principal players by the movie's end. All suffer terrible emotional pain, but will ultimately struggle through and survive. Not a Hollywood or fairy tale ending, but representative of reality.  The film also shows that despite substantial progress made by gay people, homophobia and violence against gays still happens--even in relatively progressive 21st century Germany.
summary: Sometimes life doesn't turn out OK.

reviewText: This is a great film for quite a few reasons. Since the other reviewers mention a lot of them. I’ll say ditto to the 4 and 5 reviewers and add my bit.For me this film was about separation from the plan an individual makes when they are young, and finding out that that path is not necessarily the one which is right for you.Marc seemed to come from a family of policemen and had been groomed by that family to follow in their footsteps. Anyone who has support from their parents will understand this. Parents love by trying to make sure their child doesn’t make the mistakes they made or they saw others make. They mean well, but often don’t see who their child truly is. The child is a child so blindly follows the chosen path, until they wake up.Sometimes they wake by themselves, sometime an incident wakes them. In this case Kay woke Marc.Basically if/when you wake up, it can be painful, as you realize you are truly alone in the world. However once you make peace with that, it is ever so liberating and you are free to be who and what you chose.I believe this is why we are always told not to be in such a rush to grow up. It takes time to learn how to observe before you act. This is why many of us end up with houses, spouses and children without ever understanding that these things are not what we are looking for. Or if we do want these things, we do not take into account how much of our Selves we have to give to each of these things.As far as the gay angle, well we humans love to persecute any thing, idea or one that is different, which to me translates as if you are persecuting someone you are either jealous or afraid... Yeah,  you are a “Pussy.” Instead of lashing out, go inside and figure out what the hell scares you so much and face it. Yes, gay person here. Great film on many levels.
summary: Great film about Self discovery... and other things.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: German film with sub-titles. I say that because a lot of people don't like sub-titles, I am very OK with that, I actually prefer it then bad dubbing. The 2 leads, Max Reimelt as Marc and Hanno Koffler as Kay (pronounced like Ki) both give excellent thought provoking performances. both are very handsome men and both evoke all kinds of emotional ups and downs. Briefly, Kay sees Marc at police training and literally stalks him until Marc gives in to his undeniable attraction, but he has a girlfriend and a baby. Kay and Marc's love deepens and choices need to be made. These 2 actors and the entire cast are terrific and the reason why I did 4 stars instead of 5? Why can't gay films have a happy ending now and then?  Yep, I did cry a bit. Lovely film with sterling lead performances....well worth the look-see.
Title: Free Fall

Title: Free Fall

reviewText: I going to write this review without giving anything away. Let's start with the whole cast. They acted the heck out of these parts. i almost forgot to read the "English" subtitles. I had an ideal of what the story was because every where I looked for clips and spoilers. Well I found them. It still doesn't hurt or give away from this well written and well believed movie, I was so desperate to see this movie, As I said I watched every clip I could. I loved the love stories, and especially the 2 beautiful male leads. Character names Marc & Kay. i am praying to the the Director gods that there is a sequel. I loved the digital copy so much that I will be buying DVD when is released in March.... I love those type of movies that you know that when you read about it and see clips months in advance that you feel like it a great kept secret, but know that the whole world is in on it. Okay i know I said I would try not to give anything way. Well I won't But I'll give you something to pull you in. "Marc's Mom"!!! To quote a great line from a movie this is loosely based like. "Broke back Mountain". "Marc's mom", to Kay.... How can you say that to me.. How? I love this movie... I can not wait to get the movie as well. This is a Classic, please pick it up when is released, or if you can't wait like me. Rent a digital copy. I have 2 more days to watch this again. I will enjoy it like it was my first time. "Pun" intended.I am hoping that Stephan Lacant, The Director reads my review.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: This is a movie I absolutely enjoyed on many levels. The movie gives insights into conditioned upbringing, a clear demarcation of whats considered to be right and whats wrong but at what price? Are individual freeedom and desires to be sacrificed at the altar of such beliefs? Marc in this movie is portrayed as the traditonal guy with a great family and a girlfriend who is pregnant. Everything in his life looks okay until Kay walks in and introduces him to what can best described as a whiff of fresh air. With freedom comes responsibility and for someone like Marc this is extremely difficult. He has been taught and groomed to make everyone happy at the price of his own. So when he experiences adventure, freedom, a sense of flight and happiness with Kay, he is unable to accept it or adjust to it. Interwoven within the movie premise are societal attitudes towards homosexuality. I would have preferred a happy ending of Marc with Kay but the effort to come out of a suffocating relationship  by Marc is in itself a great step forward. Highly recommended for the acting (Both Hanno and Max), chemistry between the actors and the beautiful storyline.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: This movie tells the story of not just homosexual love, it also shows how it affects those around them. It is emotional and frank, the latter being the main reason why I liked this movie. The acting was superb by all involved and revealed how we can change preferences, but not without a price. I was really caught up in the emotional burst from the leading character's wife.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: This movie affected me  the same way that Brokeback Mouuntain did. The story hinges around two police cadets one who is gay, the other who discovers over the length of the movie that he is also gay. The story is well told and well paced as the two cadets fall in love even as the straight cadet becomes a father with his live in girl friend. A very emotional film---five stars!
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Such a great movie!  Usually not about subtitles but I forgot that I was reading.  Truly a different but similar version of Brokeback Mountain.  Very good overall

reviewText: Yes good not bad at all I mean they compare it to brokeback mountain I wouldn't but this is a really good film so why not LOL!  I enjoyed the storyline as well as the acting so not your basic gay film.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Released in Germany as `Freir Fall' this has been compared to `Brokeback Mountain', but apart from it being about a man who is gay in a heterosexual relationship, I can't really see any other similarities. We meet Marc who is a cop and he has a pregnant girlfriend and what appears to be a life plan. Then at the academy he meets Kay who is more free whelin' than him and after getting off on the wrong foot they slowly hit it off.Now despite the police or polizei being all inclusive these days there is still a vast undercurrent of homophobia and this is shown and there is some violence. Soon Marc realises what he wants and moreover who he wants but societal pressures and the arrival of his new baby son are all contributing to making him want to hurt the one he really loves.This is a rather good film the two male leads are always guaranteed to put in a solid performance.  Marc is played by Hanno Kofler - `Krabat' and the excellent `Summer Storm'. Kay is played by Max Riemelt - `Napola' and `The Fourth State'. The sub titles are good to ok as they are not always a literal translation which I know some prefer but I like it told straight. This is a film that will not tick all the boxes, the ending especially may fail to deliver for some viewers; there is a limited amount of scenes of a sexual nature but nothing to frighten the horses of even a randy pony to be honest. However, this is still a very strong film with some excellent performances indeed - recommended to fans of gay themed cinema.
summary: German tale of forbidden love - with coppers!
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: One review I read prior ot screening the film called is Brokeback Mountain revisited. I guess it is, on some levels. Both are sad, sad situations with a characte, or two, layering on poor choice ontop another until there is no way out and everybody get hurt. At least no one dies inthei film, we think.It's a film with an appealing and expensicve finish which adds value to the viewing quality.The story development and the acting are superb.The actors are active, especially the blond Max, an the expressions of love and sex in very touching scenes feel real. It's what happens to the characters and the reactions from their family and community that suck. It's real life and the tale could occur anywhere, and beleive me, it does, repeatedly, and unfortunately, with the same very sad and depressing results.But, don't mind me. Be entertained, as it is entertaining and much more. Hats off to the filmmaker, actors and director. Sorry, but there are few really  "good" films availabel about this demographic and lifestyle. Rent it, buy, and tell others about it as we might be able to change society somehow and make things better...I hope.
summary: As excellent as it is sad...
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: NOTE:  I found no notice on Amazon that this is subtitled.  If you are like me, it is difficult to watch a movie AND try to read quickly enough to catch the facts of what is happening; especially in German.  Yes, "emotion" usually is more readily conveyed, but Germans typically do not overtly display their emotions, so this too is difficult (I am of German descent).  :)Fortunately, I was able to rewatch it a couple of times to pick up the threads, but the general plot was not easily engaging for me.  Yes there are the sweet spots of tenderness and affection intermingled with the torrid times of soul-searching introspection.  I found  reasonably believable societal settings which included lovely scenery, and certainly accurately portrayed consequences of "love mis-directed".  I think it is deserving of some richer, more meaty plot; perhaps a sequel....
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: The storyline had substance and the acting was good. Not your typical campy gay American flick. It was a bit dramatic!
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Bottled up feelings can come out in words or actions.  Marc doesn't talk much.  His father had to drag words out of him as a child.  In a family of policemen, the hurt and angry Marc didn't learn to express his feelings.  He acts them out, much like an adolescent would.  The problem is that he's about to become a father, lives with his pregnant girlfriend next door to his parents, and is falling in love with his Shadow, the handsome Kay, who knows he's gay.  Unable to process his feelings with words, Marc acts out and betrays everyone, including himself.  This is a brilliantly acted film.  That it is in German doesn't really matter, most of the message is visual in the body language.  Any man who has gone through the transition of fatherhood will be able to relate to the repressed feelings needing to get out.  How we deal with our feelings creates the consequences.  In a world of double values in transition this film says it all.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Gay cop falls for and "converts" straight married cop in a plot that only happens in gay movies. There's no real basis for the straight cop's sudden desire for his counterpart and so it's all just masturbatory fantasy of he the filmmaker.
Title: Free Fall

reviewText: Two cops in training.  One gay...one not, or maybe. Marc is married, with a baby on the way.  Kay (male police partner) is drawn to Marc.  On a jog, Kay kisses Marc and a brief moment of passion ensues.  Marc jogs on, but later comes back for more.  The baby comes, and Marc feels remorse because he wants to be a good father.  The two reunite, and things are fine until the wife finds out.  This film is in German with subtitles, but that doesn't detract from the great plot and fantastic actors.
Title: Free Fall
